Change Log¶

Head (not released)¶

  • Extended 32-bit generation to

    • Uniforms (random_sample() and rand())
    • Normals (standard_normal() and randn())
    • Standard Gammas (standard_gamma())
    • Standard Exponentials (standard_exponential())

    using the dtype keyword.

  • Removed random_uintegers since these are special cases of randint()

Version 1.11.2¶

  • Added keyword argument dtype to random_sample which allows for single precision as well as double precision uniforms to be generated.
In [1]: import numpy as np

In [2]: import randomstate as rs

In [3]: rs.seed(23456)

In [4]: rs.random_sample(3, dtype=np.float64)
Out[4]: array([ 0.32180029,  0.32730047,  0.92742231])

In [5]: rs.seed(23456)

In [6]: rs.random_sample(3, dtype=np.float32)
Out[6]: array([ 0.32180023,  0.12272525,  0.32730043], dtype=float32)

Version 1.11.1¶

  • Added xoroshiro128+ PRNG. This is an improved version of the xorshirt128+ PRNG and should be used instead. In the long run, xorshift128+ will likely be removed.
  • Fixed DeprecationWarning when initializing a PRNG using a single element array.

Version 1.11¶

  • Update to recent changes in NumPy’s RandomState
  • Expose system entropy through randomstate.entropy.random_entropy()
  • Add vector initialization for all PRNGs

Version 1.10.1¶

  • Added support for jumping the MRG32K3A generator
  • Added support for jumping the dSFMT generator
  • Update to recent changes in NumPy’s RandomState

Version 1.10¶

  • This is the initial release with compatibility with NumPy 1.10
